Participants.evidence: 25 patients who underwent EVLA from April 2022 to June 2023 at the Hospital das Clínicas de Pernambuco/UFPE

Intervention.evidence: This study evaluates hemodynamic and anatomic changes in great saphenous vein (GSV) tributaries after endovenous laser ablation (EVLA).

Objective.evidence: Objective: This study evaluates hemodynamic and anatomic changes in great saphenous vein (GSV) tributaries after endovenous laser ablation (EVLA).

Method_Outcome.evidence: All patients were evaluated by Doppler ultrasound preoperatively and 3 months after the surgical treatment.

Number_Randomised.evidence: This case series analyzed 112 areas in 28 lower limbs of 25 patients who underwent EVLA from April 2022 to June 2023

Number_Analysed.evidence: The results included 28 lower limbs from 23 patients

Result_Outcome.evidence: Ninety days after EVLA, all treated GSVs were occluded. The average diameter of GSV decreased in all four regions studied: saphenous-femoral junction, medium thigh, knee, and medium leg ( P ≤ .001).
